This has been removed and reverted several times. This is factual, referenced and correct. Given the pathetic record of economists predicting anything, this surely is an achievement. Not anecdotal.

the pith is, this assertion could be taken as highly controversial, please take this to the talk page instead (or give a source)
rv; above logic not applied consistently (other fact tags were left intact by editor)
let's wait for a citation, then
then fact-tag it, don't delete it (i'll do it for you)
Surely currently is appropriate and accurate. As stated before, economics is subject to fashion. Keynes today for example. "Currently" is appropriate here.
Who is to say what will happen tomorrow. "
Economics is uniquely vulnerable to "fashions". Truly NPOV would point out that it is CURRENTLY not part of the mainstream. That is not a permanent thing. Look at the revival of Keynes today...

Sorry. I'm trying to avoid the "harshness" of the words "strict enforcement" (as though it's a Nazi police state idea). It simply means maximum opennes to voluntary contracting.
